value: But chiefly are we bound to praise thee for the glorious resurrection of thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord; for he is the very Paschal Lamb, who was sacrificed for us, and hath taken away the sin of the world; who by his death hath destroyed death, and by his rising to life again hath won for us everlasting life.

For with thy co-eternal Son and Holy Spirit, thou art one God, one Lord, in Trinity of Persons and in Unity of Substance; and we celebrate the one and equal glory of thee, O Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.

Because thou didst send thy beloved Son to redeem us from sin and death, and to make us heirs in him of everlasting life; that when he shall come again in power and great triumph to judge the world, we may without shame or fear rejoice to behold his appearing.

Because thou didst give Jesus Christ, thine only Son, to be born for us; who, by the mighty power of the Holy Ghost, was made very Man of the substance of the Virgin Mary his mother; that we might be delivered from the bondage of sin, and receive power to become thy children.
Because in the mystery of the Word made flesh, thou hast caused a new light to shine in our hearts, to give the knowledge of thy glory in the face of thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who rose victorious from the dead, and doth comfort us with the blessed hope of everlasting life; for to thy faithful people, O Lord, life is changed, not ended; and when our mortal body doth lie in death, there is prepared for us a dwelling place eternal in the heavens.

Who dost bid thy faithful people cleanse their hearts, and prepare with joy for the Paschal feast; that, fervent in prayer and in works of mercy, and renewed by thy Word and Sacraments, they may come to the fullness of grace which thou hast prepared for those who love thee.

Because thou art greatly glorified in the assembly of thy saints. All thy creatures praise thee, and thy faithful servants bless thee, confessing before the rulers of this world the great Name of thine only Son.

Who, in the multitude of thy saints, hast compassed us about with so great a cloud of witnesses, that we, rejoicing in their fellowship, may run with patience the race that is set before us; and, together with them, may receive the crown of glory that fadeth not away.
Who in the obedience of thy saints hast given us an example of righteousness, and in their eternal joy a glorious pledge of the hope of our calling.
Because in Jesus Christ our Lord thou hast received us as thy sons and daughters, made us citizens of thy kingdom, and given us the Holy Spirit to guide us into all truth.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who was in every way tempted as we are, yet did not sin; by whose grace we are able to triumph over every evil, and to live no longer unto ourselves, but unto him who died for us and rose again.

Because in the love of wife and husband, thou hast given us an image of the heavenly Jerusalem, adorned as a bride for her bridegroom, thy Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who loveth her and gave himself for her, that he might make the whole creation new.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; according to whose true promise the Holy Ghost came down [on this day] from heaven, lighting upon the disciples, to teach them and to lead them into all truth; uniting peoples of many tongues in the confession of one faith, and giving to thy Church the power to serve thee as a royal priesthood, and to preach the Gospel to all nations.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who for our sins was lifted high upon the cross, that he might draw the whole world to himself; who by his suffering and death became the author of eternal salvation for all who put their trust in him.

Through thy dearly beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who after his glorious resurrection manifestly appeared to his disciples; and in their sight ascended into heaven, to prepare a place for us; that where he is, there we might also be, and reign with him in glory.
Who by water and the Holy Spirit hast made us a new people in Jesus Christ our Lord, to show forth thy glory in all the world.
For the wonderful grace and virtue declared in all thy saints, who have been chosen vessels of thy grace, and the lights of the world in their generations.
Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who on the first day of the week overcame death and the grave, and by his glorious resurrection opened to us the way of everlasting life.
Creator of the light and source of life, who hast made us in thine image, and called us to new life in Jesus Christ our Lord.

For with your co-eternal Son and Holy Spirit, you are one God, one Lord, in Trinity of Persons and in Unity of Being; and we celebrate the one and equal glory of you, O Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
Because in the mystery of the Word made flesh, you have caused a new light to shine in our hearts, to give the knowledge of your glory in the face of your son Jesus Christ our Lord.
For by water and the Holy Spirit you have made us a new people in Jesus Christ our Lord, to show forth your glory in all the world.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord. In fulfillment of his true promise, the Holy Spirit came down [on this day] from heaven, lighting upon the disciples, to teach them and to lead them into all truth; uniting peoples of many tongues in the confession of one faith, and giving to your Church the power to serve you as a royal priesthood, and to preach the Gospel to all nations.

You bid your faithful people cleanse their hearts, and prepare with joy for the Paschal feast; that, fervent in prayer and in works of mercy, and renewed by your Word and Sacraments, they may come to the fullness of grace which you have prepared for those who love you.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who was tempted in every way as we are, yet did not sin. By his grace we are able to triumph over every evil, and to live no longer for ourselves alone, but for him who died for us and rose again.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who rose victorious from the dead, and comforts us with the blessed hope of everlasting life. For to your faithful people, O Lord, life is changed, not ended; and when our mortal body lies in death, there is prepared for us a dwelling place eternal in the heavens.

Because in the love of wife and husband, you have given us an image of the heavenly Jerusalem, adorned as a bride for her bridegroom, your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who loves her and gave himself for her, that he might make the whole creation new.

Through your dearly beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord. After his glorious resurrection he openly appeared to his disciples, and in their sight ascended into heaven, to prepare a place for us; that where he is, there we might also be, and reign with him in glory.

Because you sent your beloved Son to redeem us from sin and death, and to make us heirs in him of everlasting life; that when he shall come again in power and great triumph to judge the world, we may without shame or fear rejoice to behold his appearing.
For the wonderful grace and virtue declared in all your saints, who have been the chosen vessels of your grace, and the lights of the world in their generations.
Because in Jesus Christ our Lord you have received us as your sons and daughters, made us citizens of your kingdom, and given us the Holy Spirit to guide us into all truth.

But chiefly are we bound to praise you for the glorious resurrection of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; for he is the true Paschal Lamb, who was sacrificed for us, and has taken away the sin of the world. By his death he has destroyed death, and by his rising to life again he has won for us everlasting life.
Because in the obedience of your saints you have given us an example of righteousness, and in their eternal joy a glorious pledge of the hope of our calling.
Through Jesus Christ our Lord; who on the first day of the week overcame death and the grave, and by his glorious resurrection opened to us the way of everlasting life.

Because you are greatly glorified in the assembly of your saints. All your creatures praise you, and your faithful servants bless you, confessing before the rulers of this world the great Name of your only Son.

For in the multitude of your saints you have surrounded us with a great cloud of witnesses, that we might rejoice in their fellowship, and run with endurance the race that is set before us; and, together with them, receive the crown of glory that never fades away.
For you are the source of light and life, you made us in your image, and called us to new life in Jesus Christ our Lord.

Because you gave Jesus Christ, your only Son, to be born for us; who, by the mighty power of the Holy Spirit, was made perfect Man of the flesh of the Virgin Mary his mother; so that we might be delivered from the bondage of sin, and receive power to become your children.

Through Jesus Christ our Lord. For our sins he was lifted high upon the cross, that he might draw the whole world to himself; and, by his suffering and death, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who put their trust in him.
Alleluia
Alleluia

value.verse: O God, you are my God; eagerly I seek you; *
value.halfverse:
my soul thirsts for you, my flesh faints for you,
 as in a barren and dry land where there is no water.

value.verse: Therefore I have gazed upon you in your holy place, *
value.halfverse: that I might behold your power and your glory.

value.verse: For your loving-kindness is better than life itself; *
value.halfverse: my lips shall give you praise.

value.verse: So will I bless you as long as I live *
value.halfverse: and lift up my hands in your Name.
and my mouth praises you with joyful lips,
value.verse: My soul is content, as with marrow and fatness, *

value.halfverse: and meditate on you in the night watches.
value.verse: When I remember you upon my bed, *

value.halfverse: and under the shadow of your wings I will rejoice.
value.verse: For you have been my helper, *
My soul clings to you; *
value.halfverse: your right hand holds me fast.

value.verse: [May those who seek my life to destroy it *
value.halfverse: go down into the depths of the earth;
and let them be food for jackals.

value.verse:
But the king will rejoice in God;
all those who swear by him will be glad; *
Teach me, O LORD, the way of your statutes, *
value.halfverse: and I shall keep it to the end.
I shall keep it with all my heart.
value.verse: Give me understanding, and I shall keep your law; *
Make me go in the path of your commandments, *
value.halfverse: for that is my desire.
and not to unjust gain.
value.verse: Incline my heart to your decrees *
Turn my eyes from watching what is worthless; *
value.halfverse: give me life in your ways.
which you make to those who fear you.
value.verse: Fulfill your promise to your servant, *
Turn away the reproach which I dread, *
value.halfverse: because your judgments are good.

value.verse: Behold, I long for your commandments; *
value.halfverse: in your righteousness preserve my life.

value.verse: LORD, do not rebuke me in your anger; *
value.halfverse: do not punish me in your wrath.

value.verse: Have pity on me, LORD, for I am weak; *
value.halfverse: heal me, LORD, for my bones are racked.
how long, O LORD, how long?
value.verse: My spirit shakes with terror; *

value.halfverse: save me for your mercy’s sake.
value.verse: Turn, O LORD, and deliver me; *
For in death no one remembers you; *
value.halfverse: and who will give you thanks in the grave?

value.verse: I grow weary because of my groaning; *
value.halfverse:
every night I drench my bed
 and flood my couch with tears.
and worn away because of all my enemies.
value.verse: My eyes are wasted with grief *

value.halfverse: for the LORD has heard the sound of my weeping.
the LORD accepts my prayer.
value.verse: The LORD has heard my supplication; *
All my enemies shall be confounded and quake with fear; *
value.halfverse: they shall turn back and suddenly be put to shame.

value.verse: I waited patiently upon the LORD; *
value.halfverse: he stooped to me and heard my cry.

value.verse: He lifted me out of the desolate pit, out of the mire and clay; *
value.halfverse: he set my feet upon a high cliff and made my footing sure.

many shall see, and stand in awe,
 and put their trust in the LORD.
value.verse:
He put a new song in my mouth,
a song of praise to our God; *
Happy are they who trust in the LORD! *
value.halfverse: they do not resort to evil spirits or turn to false gods.

value.verse:
Great things are they that you have done, O LORD my God!
how great your wonders and your plans for us! *
value.halfverse: there is none who can be compared with you.

value.verse: Oh, that I could make them known and tell them! *
value.halfverse: but they are more than I can count.

value.verse: In sacrifice and offering you take no pleasure *

and so I said, “Behold, I come.
value.verse: Burnt-offering and sin-offering you have not required, *

value.halfverse:
‘I love to do your will, O my God;
 your law is deep in my heart.’”

behold, I did not restrain my lips;

I have spoken of your faithfulness and your deliverance; *
value.halfverse: I have not concealed your love and faithfulness from the great congregation.
let your love and your faithfulness keep me safe for ever,
value.verse:
You are the LORD;
do not withhold your compassion from me; *

value.halfverse:
they are more in number than the hairs of my head,

value.verse:
For innumerable troubles have crowded upon me;
my sins have overtaken me, and I cannot see; *

value.halfverse: O LORD, make haste to help me.
let them draw back and be disgraced who take pleasure in my misfortune.

[Let them be ashamed and altogether dismayed

let those who love your salvation continually say,

the Lord will have regard for me.

value.verse:
Lord God, heavenly King,
almighty God and Father,

we worship you, we give you thanks,

Lord Jesus Christ, only Son of the Father,
Lord God, Lamb of God,

you alone are the Most High,

Jesus Christ,

in the beauty of holiness have I begotten you,

he will smash heads over the wide earth.

value.halfverse: his Name is great in Israel.
and his dwelling is in Zion.

There he broke the flashing arrows, *
value.halfverse: the shield, the sword, and the weapons of battle.

value.halfverse: more splendid than the everlasting mountains!
none of the warriors can lift a hand.

The strong of heart have been despoiled;
they sink into sleep; *

who can stand before you when you are angry?

sing the glory of his Name;
 sing the glory of his praise.
because of your great strength your enemies cringe before you.

so that they went through the water on foot, *

In his might he rules for ever;
his eyes keep watch over the nations; *

make the voice of his praise to be heard;

but you brought us out into a place of refreshment.

we went through fire and water; *

do not be jealous of those who do wrong.

dwell in the land and feed on its riches.

and he will bring it to pass.

value.verse: For evildoers shall be cut off, *

and all that is within me, bless his holy Name.

and judgment for all who are oppressed.

slow to anger and of great kindness.

value.halfverse: so is his mercy great upon those who fear him.
so far has he removed our sins from us.
value.verse: As far as the east is from the west, *

we flourish like a flower of the field;

value.halfverse: and his righteousness on children’s children;
value.verse: But the merciful goodness of the LORD endures for ever on those who fear him, *
On those who keep his covenant *
value.halfverse: and remember his commandments and do them.

value.verse: The LORD has set his throne in heaven, *
value.halfverse: and his kingship has dominion over all.

value.verse:
Bless the LORD, you angels of his,
you mighty ones who do his bidding, *
value.halfverse: and hearken to the voice of his word.
you ministers of his who do his will.

in all places of his dominion; *

and his mercy endures for ever.

from the east and from the west,
 from the north and from the south.

antiphon.12-17: O come, Thou Rod of Jesse, free Thine own from Satan's tyranny; From depths of hell Thy people save, And give them victory o’er the grave.
antiphon.12-21: O come, Adonai, Lord of might, Who to Thy tribes, on Sinai's height, In ancient times didst give the law In cloud and majesty and awe.
antiphon.12-20: O come, Thou Key of David, come And open wide our heav'nly home; Make safe the way that leads on high, And close the path to misery.
antiphon.12-19: O come, Thou Dayspring, from on high, And cheer us by Thy drawing nigh; Disperse the gloomy clouds of night, And death's dark shadows put to flight.
antiphon.12-18: O come, Thou Rod of Jesse, free Thine own from Satan's tyranny; From depths of hell Thy people save, And give them victory o'er the grave.
antiphon.12-16: O come, O come, Emmanuel, And ransom captive Israel, That mourns in lonely exile here, Until the Son of God appear.
antiphon.12-23: O come, Desire of nations, bind All peoples in one heart and mind; Bid envy, strife and quarrels cease; Fill the whole world with heaven’s peace.
antiphon.12-22: O come, Thou Wisdom from on high, And order all things, far and nigh; To us the path of knowledge show, And cause us in her ways to go.

My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord,
my spirit rejoices in God my Savior; *
value.halfverse: for he has looked with favor on his lowly servant.

the Almighty has done great things for me,
and holy is his Name.
value.verse: From this day all generations will call me blessed: *

He has shown the strength of his arm, *
value.halfverse: he has scattered the proud in their conceit.
and has lifted up the lowly.
value.verse: He has cast down the mighty from their thrones, *

value.halfverse: and the rich he has sent away empty.
value.verse: He has filled the hungry with good things, *

value.halfverse: for he has remembered his promise of mercy,
value.verse: He has come to the help of his servant Israel, *

value.verse: The promise he made to our fathers, *

value.halfverse: the generation of the upright will be blessed.
and their righteousness will last for ever.
value.verse: Wealth and riches will be in their house, *

value.halfverse: the righteous are merciful and full of compassion.

value.verse: It is good for them to be generous in lending *

value.verse: For they will never be shaken; *

their heart is right;

 they will hold up their head with honor.

for my enemies are hounding me; *

their only thought is to do me evil.

they spy upon my footsteps;
 because they seek my life.

throughout all generations for ever.

that we may give thanks to your holy Name

 Hallelujah!

their cities plowed under, the memory of them perished;

see the misery I suffer from those who hate me,
 O you who lift me up from the gate of death;

So that I may tell of all your praises
and rejoice in your salvation *

my shield, the horn of my salvation, and my refuge;
 you are worthy of praise.

and the torrents of oblivion made me afraid.

the roots of the mountains shook;
 they reeled because of his anger.

with a storm cloud under his feet.

the Most High uttered his voice.

at your battle cry, O LORD,
 at the blast of the breath of your nostrils.

The beds of the seas were uncovered,
and the foundations of the world laid bare, *

for they were too mighty for me.

He delivered me from my strong enemies
and from those who hated me; *

and runs down upon the collar of his robe.

let those who take pleasure in my misfortune
 draw back and be disgraced.

 “Great is the LORD!”
come to me speedily, O God.

who speaks the truth from his heart.

shall never be overthrown.

Hallelujah!

That I may see the prosperity of your elect

In Egypt they did not consider your marvelous works,
nor remember the abundance of your love; *

value.halfverse: to make his power known.
and he led them through the deep as through a desert.

not one of them was left.

value.halfverse: and sang him songs of praise.

and they put God to the test in the desert.

value.halfverse: but sent leanness into their soul.
value.verse: He gave them what they asked, *

and flames devoured the wicked.

when enemies rose up against us;

value.halfverse: in their fierce anger toward us;
and the torrent gone over us;

value.halfverse: the snare is broken, and we have escaped.

value.verse: Our help is in the Name of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: the maker of heaven and earth.

value.verse:
You are God: we praise you;
You are the Lord; we acclaim you;
You are the eternal Father:
All creation worships you.
To you all angels, all the powers of heaven,
Cherubim and Seraphim, sing in endless praise:
    Holy, holy, holy Lord, God of power and might,
    heaven and earth are full of your glory.
The glorious company of apostles praise you.
The noble fellowship of prophets praise you.
The white-robed army of martyrs praise you.
Throughout the world the holy Church acclaims you;
    Father, of majesty unbounded,
    your true and only Son, worthy of all worship,
    and the Holy Spirit, advocate and guide. 
You, Christ, are the king of glory,
the eternal Son of the Father.
When you became man to set us free
you did not shun the Virgin's womb.
You overcame the sting of death
and opened the kingdom of heaven to all believers.
You are seated at God's right hand in glory.
We believe that you will come and be our judge.
    Come then, Lord, and help your people,
    bought with the price of your own blood,
    and bring us with your saints
    to glory everlasting.

will you forget me for ever? *

and to those who speak evil against me.

oh, deal with me according to your Name; *

value.verse: For I am poor and needy, *
value.halfverse: and my heart is wounded within me.

value.verse: I have faded away like a shadow when it lengthens; *

value.halfverse: they see and shake their heads.

value.halfverse: save me for your mercy’s sake.
value.verse: Help me, O LORD my God; *

value.halfverse: that you, O LORD, have done it.
value.verse: Let them know that this is your hand, *
They may curse, but you will bless; *
value.halfverse:
let those who rise up against me be put to shame,
 and your servant will rejoice.

value.verse: Let my accusers be clothed with disgrace *
value.halfverse: and wrap themselves in their shame as in a cloak.
in the midst of the multitude will I praise him;
value.verse: I will give great thanks to the LORD with my mouth; *

value.halfverse: to save his life from those who would condemn him.
value.verse: Because he stands at the right hand of the needy, *

value.halfverse: deliver me in your righteousness.
value.verse:
In you, O LORD, have I taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame; *

value.halfverse: make haste to deliver me.
value.verse: Incline your ear to me; *

value.halfverse: for the sake of your Name, lead me and guide me.
value.verse:
Be my strong rock, a castle to keep me safe,
for you are my crag and my stronghold; *
Take me out of the net that they have secretly set for me, *
value.halfverse: for you are my tower of strength.

value.verse: Into your hands I commend my spirit, *
value.halfverse:
for you have redeemed me,
 O LORD, O God of truth.

value.verse: I hate those who cling to worthless idols, *
value.halfverse: and I put my trust in the LORD.

for you have seen my affliction;
 you know my distress.
value.verse: I will rejoice and be glad because of your mercy; *
You have not shut me up in the power of the enemy; *
value.halfverse: you have set my feet in an open place.

my eye is consumed with sorrow,
 and also my throat and my belly.
value.verse: Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I am in trouble; *

value.halfverse:
my strength fails me because of affliction,
 and my bones are consumed.
value.verse:
For my life is wasted with grief,
and my years with sighing; *

I have become a reproach to all my enemies and even to my neighbors,
a dismay to those of my acquaintance; *
value.halfverse: when they see me in the street they avoid me.

value.verse: I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind; *
value.halfverse: I am as useless as a broken pot.

they put their heads together against me;
 they plot to take my life.
value.verse:
For I have heard the whispering of the crowd;
fear is all around; *

value.halfverse: I have said, “You are my God.
value.verse: But as for me, I have trusted in you, O LORD. *
My times are in your hand; *
value.halfverse:
rescue me from the hand of my enemies,
 and from those who persecute me.

value.verse: Make your face to shine upon your servant, *
value.halfverse: and in your loving-kindness save me.”

value.verse: LORD, let me not be ashamed for having called upon you; *
value.halfverse:
rather, let the wicked be put to shame;
 let them be silent in the grave.
haughtily, disdainfully, and with contempt.
value.verse: Let the lying lips be silenced which speak against the righteous, *

which you have done in the sight of all
 for those who put their trust in you.

How great is your goodness, O LORD!
which you have laid up for those who fear you; *
You hide them in the covert of your presence from those who slander them; *
value.halfverse: you keep them in your shelter from the strife of tongues.

value.verse: Blessed be the LORD! *
value.halfverse: for he has shown me the wonders of his love in a besieged city.

Nevertheless, you heard the sound of my entreaty
 when I cried out to you.
value.verse:
Yet I said in my alarm,
“I have been cut off from the sight of your eyes.” *
Love the LORD, all you who worship him; *
value.halfverse:
the LORD protects the faithful,
 but repays to the full those who act haughtily.

value.verse: Be strong and let your heart take courage, *
value.halfverse: all you who wait for the LORD.
from age to age my mouth will proclaim your faithfulness.
value.verse: Your love, O LORD, for ever will I sing; *
For I am persuaded that your love is established for ever; *
value.halfverse: you have set your faithfulness firmly in the heavens.
I have sworn an oath to David my servant:
value.verse: “I have made a covenant with my chosen one; *

value.halfverse: and preserve your throne for all generations.’”
value.verse: ‘I will establish your line for ever, *

value.halfverse: and to your faithfulness in the assembly of the holy ones;
value.verse: The heavens bear witness to your wonders, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: who is like the LORD among the gods?
value.verse: For who in the skies can be compared to the LORD? *

value.halfverse: great and terrible to all those round about him.
value.verse: God is much to be feared in the council of the holy ones, *

value.halfverse: O mighty LORD, your faithfulness is all around you.
value.verse: Who is like you, LORD God of hosts? *
You rule the raging of the sea *
value.halfverse: and still the surging of its waves.

value.verse: You have crushed Rahab of the deep with a deadly wound; *
value.halfverse: you have scattered your enemies with your mighty arm.

value.verse: Yours are the heavens; the earth also is yours; *
value.halfverse: you laid the foundations of the world and all that is in it.
Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your Name.
value.verse: You have made the north and the south; *

value.halfverse: strong is your hand and high is your right hand.
value.verse: You have a mighty arm; *

value.halfverse: love and truth go before your face.
value.verse: Righteousness and justice are the foundations of your throne; *

value.halfverse: they walk, O LORD, in the light of your presence.
value.verse: Happy are the people who know the festal shout! *
They rejoice daily in your Name; *
value.halfverse: they are jubilant in your righteousness.

value.verse: For you are the glory of their strength, *
value.halfverse: and by your favor our might is exalted.
The Holy One of Israel is our King.
value.verse: Truly, the LORD is our ruler; *
Give the King your justice, O God, *
value.halfverse: and your righteousness to the King’s son;
and the poor with justice.
value.verse: That he may rule your people righteously *

value.halfverse: and the little hills bring righteousness.
value.verse: That the mountains may bring prosperity to the people, *

value.halfverse: he shall rescue the poor and crush the oppressor.
value.verse: He shall defend the needy among the people; *

value.halfverse: from one generation to another.
value.verse: He shall live as long as the sun and moon endure, *

value.halfverse: like showers that water the earth.
value.verse: He shall come down like rain upon the mown field, *
In his time shall the righteous flourish; *
value.halfverse: there shall be abundance of peace till the moon shall be no more.

value.verse: He shall rule from sea to sea, *
value.halfverse: and from the River to the ends of the earth.

value.verse: His foes shall bow down before him, *
value.halfverse: and his enemies lick the dust.

value.verse: The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall pay tribute, *
value.halfverse: and the kings of Arabia and Saba offer gifts.
and all the nations do him service.
value.verse: All kings shall bow down before him, *
For he shall deliver the poor who cries out in distress, *
value.halfverse: and the oppressed who has no helper.

value.verse: He shall have pity on the lowly and poor; *
value.halfverse: he shall preserve the lives of the needy.

value.verse: He shall redeem their lives from oppression and violence, *
value.halfverse: and dear shall their blood be in his sight.

may prayer be made for him always,
 and may they bless him all the day long.
value.verse:
Long may he live!
and may there be given to him gold from Arabia; *

May there be abundance of grain on the earth,
growing thick even on the hilltops; *
value.halfverse:
may its fruit flourish like Lebanon,
 and its grain like grass upon the earth.

value.verse:
May his Name remain for ever
and be established as long as the sun endures; *
value.halfverse: may all the nations bless themselves in him and call him blessed.

value.verse: Blessed be the Lord GOD, the God of Israel, *
value.halfverse: who alone does wondrous deeds!

value.verse: And blessed be his glorious Name for ever! *
value.halfverse: and may all the earth be filled with his glory. Amen. Amen.
attack those who are attacking me.

Take up shield and armor *
value.halfverse: and rise up to help me.

value.verse: Draw the sword and bar the way against those who pursue me; *
value.halfverse: say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”

value.verse: Let those who seek after my life be shamed and humbled; *
value.halfverse: let those who plot my ruin fall back and be dismayed.
and let the angel of the LORD drive them away.
value.verse: Let them be like chaff before the wind, *

value.halfverse: and let the angel of the LORD pursue them.
value.verse: Let their way be dark and slippery, *

value.verse: For they have secretly spread a net for me without a cause; *
Let ruin come upon them unawares; *
value.halfverse:
let them be caught in the net they hid;
 let them fall into the pit they dug.

value.verse: Then I will be joyful in the LORD; *

 the poor and needy from those who rob them.”

and humbled myself by fasting.

I behaved like one who mourns for his mother,
 bowed down and grieving.
value.verse:
I prayed with my whole heart,
as one would for a friend or a brother; *

value.verse:
But when I stumbled, they were glad and gathered together;
they gathered against me; *

value.halfverse:
rescue me from the roaring beasts,

value.verse: I will give you thanks in the great congregation; *

For they do not plan for peace, *
value.halfverse: but invent deceitful schemes against the quiet in the land.
“Aha! we saw it with our own eyes.”
value.verse: They opened their mouths at me and said, *

value.verse: You saw it, O LORD; do not be silent; *
Awake, arise, to my cause! *
value.halfverse: to my defense, my God and my Lord!

value.verse:
Give me justice, O LORD my God,
according to your righteousness; *
value.halfverse: do not let them triumph over me.
Do not let them say, “We have swallowed him up.”
value.verse:
Do not let them say in their hearts,
“Aha! just what we want!” *

value.halfverse: let those who boast against me be clothed with dismay and shame.

Let those who favor my cause sing out with joy and be glad; *
value.halfverse:
let them say always, “Great is the LORD,
 who desires the prosperity of his servant.”
and of your praise all the day long.

 my good above all other.”

value.halfverse: upon those who are noble among the people.

it is you who uphold my lot.

value.halfverse: my heart teaches me, night after night.

nor let your holy one see the Pit.

in your presence there is fullness of joy,

from where is my help to come?

My help comes from the LORD, *
value.halfverse: the maker of heaven and earth.
and he who watches over you will not fall asleep.

Behold, he who keeps watch over Israel *
value.halfverse: shall neither slumber nor sleep;

value.verse: The LORD himself watches over you; *
value.halfverse: the LORD is your shade at your right hand,
nor the moon by night.
value.verse: So that the sun shall not strike you by day, *

value.halfverse: it is he who shall keep you safe.
value.verse: The LORD shall preserve you from all evil; *

value.halfverse: from this time forth for evermore.
value.verse: The LORD shall watch over your going out and your coming in, *

the Moabites and the Hagarenes;

Gebal, and Ammon, and Amalek; *

to Sisera, and to Jabin at the river of Kishon:

Make their leaders like Oreb and Zeëb, *
value.halfverse: and all their commanders like Zebah and Zalmunna,

value.halfverse: the fields of God as our possession.”

value.halfverse: and like chaff before the wind;
like the flame that sets mountains ablaze.

value.halfverse: and terrify them with your storm;
value.verse: Drive them with your tempest *
Cover their faces with shame, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: that they may seek your Name.
let them be put to confusion and perish.

value.halfverse: you alone are the Most High over all the earth.

before him there is a consuming flame,
 and round about him a raging storm.

those who have made a covenant with me

value.halfverse: your offerings are always before me.
nor he-goats out of your pens;

value.halfverse: the herds in their thousands upon the hills.

value.halfverse: and the creatures of the fields are in my sight.
value.verse: I know every bird in the sky, *

value.halfverse: for the whole world is mine and all that is in it.

value.halfverse: or drink the blood of goats?
value.verse: Do you think I eat the flesh of bulls, *
Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and make good your vows to the Most High.

value.verse: Call upon me in the day of trouble; *
value.halfverse: I will deliver you, and you shall honor me.”

“Why do you recite my statutes,
 and take my covenant upon your lips;

value.verse: Since you refuse discipline, *

value.halfverse: and you cast in your lot with adulterers.
value.verse: When you see a thief, you make him your friend, *

value.verse: You have loosed your lips for evil, *

and cleanse me from my sin.

and upright in your judgment.

value.verse: For behold, you look for truth deep within me, *

value.verse: Purge me from my sin, and I shall be pure; *

value.halfverse: and blot out all my iniquities.
value.verse: Hide your face from my sins *

value.halfverse: and renew a right spirit within me.

value.verse: Cast me not away from your presence *

and sustain me with your bountiful Spirit.

value.halfverse:
and my tongue shall sing of your righteousness,
 O God of my salvation.

because my hands were clean he rewarded me;

 your loving care makes me great.

value.verse: You prepared the ground for it; *
The mountains were covered by its shadow *
value.halfverse: and the towering cedar trees by its boughs.

value.verse: You stretched out its tendrils to the Sea *
value.halfverse: and its branches to the River.

value.verse: Why have you broken down its wall, *
value.halfverse: so that all who pass by pluck off its grapes?
and the beasts of the field have grazed upon it.
value.verse: The wild boar of the forest has ravaged it, *

value.halfverse: preserve what your right hand has planted.
value.verse:
Turn now, O God of hosts, look down from heaven;
behold and tend this vine; *

value.halfverse: at the rebuke of your countenance let them perish.
value.verse: They burn it with fire like rubbish; *

value.halfverse: and son of man you have made so strong for yourself.
value.verse: Let your hand be upon the man of your right hand, *

value.halfverse: give us life, that we may call upon your Name.
value.verse: And so will we never turn away from you; *

value.halfverse: show the light of your countenance, and we shall be saved.
value.verse: Restore us, O LORD God of hosts; *

value.halfverse: let those who hate him flee before him.
value.verse: Let God arise, and let his enemies be scattered; *

value.halfverse: as the wax melts at the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
value.verse: Let them vanish like smoke when the wind drives it away; *
But let the righteous be glad and rejoice before God; *
value.halfverse: let them also be merry and joyful.
YAHWEH is his Name, rejoice before him!
value.verse:
Sing to God, sing praises to his Name;
exalt him who rides upon the heavens; *

value.halfverse: God in his holy habitation!
value.verse: Father of orphans, defender of widows, *
God gives the solitary a home and brings forth prisoners into freedom; *
value.halfverse: but the rebels shall live in dry places.

value.verse: O God, when you went forth before your people, *
value.halfverse: when you marched through the wilderness,

value.verse:
The earth shook, and the skies poured down rain,
at the presence of God, the God of Sinai, *
value.halfverse: at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
you refreshed the land when it was weary.
value.verse: You sent a gracious rain, O God, upon your inheritance; *

value.halfverse: in your goodness, O God, you have made provision for the poor.
value.verse: Your people found their home in it; *
The Lord gave the word; *
value.halfverse: great was the company of women who bore the tidings:
the women at home are dividing the spoils.”
value.verse: “Kings with their armies are fleeing away; *

value.halfverse:
you shall be like a dove whose wings are covered with silver,
 whose feathers are like green gold.
value.verse: Though you lingered among the sheepfolds, *

value.halfverse: it was like snow falling in Zalmon.
value.verse: When the Almighty scattered kings, *
O mighty mountain, O hill of Bashan! *
value.halfverse: O rugged mountain, O hill of Bashan!

value.verse:
Why do you look with envy, O rugged mountain,
at the hill which God chose for his resting place? *
value.halfverse: truly, the LORD will dwell there for ever.

value.verse:
The chariots of God are twenty thousand,
even thousands of thousands; *
value.halfverse: the Lord comes in holiness from Sinai.
that the LORD God might dwell among them.
value.verse:
You have gone up on high and led captivity captive;
you have received gifts even from your enemies, *
Blessed be the Lord day by day, *
value.halfverse: the God of our salvation, who bears our burdens.

value.verse: He is our God, the God of our salvation; *
value.halfverse: God is the LORD, by whom we escape death.

value.verse: LORD, you have searched me out and known me; *
value.halfverse:
you know my sitting down and my rising up;
 you discern my thoughts from afar.

value.verse: You trace my journeys and my resting-places *
value.halfverse: and are acquainted with all my ways.

value.verse: Indeed, there is not a word on my lips, *
value.halfverse: but you, O LORD, know it altogether.
and lay your hand upon me.
value.verse: You press upon me behind and before *

value.halfverse: it is so high that I cannot attain to it.
value.verse: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; *

value.halfverse: where can I flee from your presence?
value.verse: Where can I go then from your Spirit? *

value.halfverse: if I make the grave my bed, you are there also.
value.verse: If I climb up to heaven, you are there; *

value.halfverse: and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea,
value.verse: If I take the wings of the morning *

value.halfverse: and your right hand hold me fast.
value.verse: Even there your hand will lead me *
If I say, “Surely the darkness will cover me, *
value.halfverse: and the light around me turn to night,”
darkness and light to you are both alike.
value.verse:
Darkness is not dark to you;
the night is as bright as the day; *
For you yourself created my inmost parts; *
value.halfverse: you knit me together in my mother’s womb.

value.verse: I will thank you because I am marvelously made; *
value.halfverse: your works are wonderful, and I know it well.

while I was being made in secret
 and woven in the depths of the earth.
value.verse: My body was not hidden from you, *

Your eyes beheld my limbs, yet unfinished in the womb;
all of them were written in your book; *
value.halfverse:
they were fashioned day by day,
 when as yet there was none of them.

value.verse: How deep I find your thoughts, O God! *
value.halfverse: how great is the sum of them!
to count them all, my life span would need to be like yours.
value.verse: If I were to count them, they would be more in number than the sand; *
[Oh, that you would slay the wicked, O God! *
value.halfverse: You that thirst for blood, depart from me.

value.verse: They speak despitefully against you; *
value.halfverse: your enemies take your Name in vain.

value.verse: Do I not hate those, O LORD, who hate you? *
value.halfverse: and do I not loathe those who rise up against you?

value.verse: I hate them with a perfect hatred; *
value.halfverse: they have become my own enemies.
try me and know my restless thoughts.
value.verse: Search me out, O God, and know my heart; *
Look well whether there be any wickedness in me *
value.halfverse: and lead me in the way that is everlasting.]

value.verse:
O gracious Light, Lord Jesus Christ,
in you the Father's glory shone.
Immortal, holy, blest is he,
and blest are you, his holy Son.

Now sunset comes, but light shines forth,
the lamps are lit to pierce the night.
Praise Father, Son, and Spirit: God
who dwells in the eternal light.

Worthy are you of endless praise,
O Son of God, Life-giving Lord;
wherefore you are through all the earth
and in the highest heaven adored.

value.halfverse: for I am poor and in misery.
value.verse: Bow down your ear, O LORD, and answer me, *

value.halfverse: save your servant who puts his trust in you.
value.verse: Keep watch over my life, for I am faithful; *

value.halfverse: I call upon you all the day long.
value.verse: Be merciful to me, O LORD, for you are my God; *

value.halfverse: for to you, O LORD, I lift up my soul.
value.verse: Gladden the soul of your servant, *

value.halfverse: and great is your love toward all who call upon you.
value.verse: For you, O LORD, are good and forgiving, *
Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer, *
value.halfverse: and attend to the voice of my supplications.
for you will answer me.
value.verse: In the time of my trouble I will call upon you, *

value.halfverse: nor anything like your works.
value.verse: Among the gods there is none like you, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: and glorify your Name.
value.verse: All the nations you have made will come and worship you, O LORD, *

value.halfverse: and you alone are God.
value.verse:
For you are great;
you do wondrous things; *

value.halfverse: knit my heart to you that I may fear your Name.
value.verse:
Teach me your way, O LORD,
and I will walk in your truth; *

value.halfverse: and glorify your Name for evermore.
value.verse: I will thank you, O LORD my God, with all my heart, *
For great is your love toward me; *
value.halfverse: you have delivered me from the nethermost Pit.

value.verse:
The arrogant rise up against me, O God,
and a band of violent men seeks my life; *
value.halfverse: they have not set you before their eyes.

value.verse: But you, O LORD, are gracious and full of compassion, *
value.halfverse: slow to anger, and full of kindness and truth.

give your strength to your servant;
 and save the child of your handmaid.
value.verse: Turn to me and have mercy upon me; *

value.halfverse: because you, O LORD, have helped me and comforted me.
value.verse:
Show me a sign of your favor,
so that those who hate me may see it and be ashamed; *

value.halfverse: that I may live and keep your word.
value.verse: Deal bountifully with your servant, *
Open my eyes, that I may see *
value.halfverse: the wonders of your law.
do not hide your commandments from me.
value.verse: I am a stranger here on earth; *

value.halfverse: with longing for your judgments.
value.verse: My soul is consumed at all times *

value.halfverse: cursed are they who stray from your commandments!
value.verse: You have rebuked the insolent; *
Turn from me shame and rebuke, *
value.halfverse: for I have kept your decrees.

value.verse: Even though rulers sit and plot against me, *
value.halfverse: I will meditate on your statutes.

value.verse: For your decrees are my delight, *
value.halfverse: and they are my counselors.
before the gods I will sing your praise.
value.verse: I will give thanks to you, O LORD, with my whole heart; *

I will bow down toward your holy temple
and praise your Name, *
value.halfverse: because of your love and faithfulness;
and your word above all things.
value.verse: For you have glorified your Name *
When I called, you answered me; *
value.halfverse: you increased my strength within me.

value.verse: All the kings of the earth will praise you, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: when they have heard the words of your mouth.

value.verse: They will sing of the ways of the LORD, *
value.halfverse: that great is the glory of the LORD.

value.verse: Though the LORD be high, he cares for the lowly; *
value.halfverse: he perceives the haughty from afar.

value.verse: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, you keep me safe; *
value.halfverse:
you stretch forth your hand against the fury of my enemies;
 your right hand shall save me.

value.verse: The LORD will make good his purpose for me; *
value.halfverse:
O LORD, your love endures for ever;
 do not abandon the works of your hands.

value.verse: Save me, O God, by your Name; *
value.halfverse: in your might, defend my cause.

value.verse: Hear my prayer, O God; *
value.halfverse: give ear to the words of my mouth.
those who have no regard for God.
value.verse:
For the arrogant have risen up against me,
and the ruthless have sought my life, *

value.halfverse: it is the Lord who sustains my life.
value.verse: Behold, God is my helper; *

value.halfverse: in your faithfulness, destroy them.
value.verse: Render evil to those who spy on me; *
I will offer you a freewill sacrifice *
value.halfverse: and praise your Name, O LORD, for it is good.

value.verse: For you have rescued me from every trouble, *
value.halfverse: and my eye has seen the ruin of my foes.

value.verse:
Hallelujah!
How good it is to sing praises to our God! *
value.halfverse: how pleasant it is to honor him with praise!

value.verse: The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem; *
value.halfverse: he gathers the exiles of Israel.
and binds up their wounds.
value.verse: He heals the brokenhearted *

value.halfverse: and calls them all by their names.
value.verse: He counts the number of the stars *

value.halfverse: there is no limit to his wisdom.
value.verse: Great is our LORD and mighty in power; *

value.halfverse: but casts the wicked to the ground.
value.verse: The LORD lifts up the lowly, *

value.halfverse: make music to our God upon the harp.
value.verse: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; *

value.halfverse: and prepares rain for the earth;
value.verse: He covers the heavens with clouds *

value.halfverse: and green plants to serve mankind.
value.verse: He makes grass to grow upon the mountains *
He provides food for flocks and herds *
value.halfverse: and for the young ravens when they cry.

value.verse: He is not impressed by the might of a horse; *
value.halfverse: he has no pleasure in the strength of a man;

value.verse: But the LORD has pleasure in those who fear him, *
value.halfverse: in those who await his gracious favor.

value.verse: Worship the LORD, O Jerusalem; *
value.halfverse: praise your God, O Zion;

value.verse: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates; *
value.halfverse: he has blessed your children within you.
he satisfies you with the finest wheat.
value.verse: He has established peace on your borders; *
He sends out his command to the earth, *
value.halfverse: and his word runs very swiftly.

value.verse: He gives snow like wool; *
value.halfverse: he scatters hoarfrost like ashes.

value.verse: He scatters his hail like bread crumbs; *
value.halfverse: who can stand against his cold?
he blows with his wind, and the waters flow.
value.verse: He sends forth his word and melts them; *

value.halfverse: his statutes and his judgments to Israel.
value.verse: He declares his word to Jacob, *

value.halfverse:
to them he has not revealed his judgments.
 Hallelujah!
value.verse: He has not done so to any other nation; *
You tyrant, why do you boast of wickedness *
value.halfverse: against the godly all day long?

value.verse:
You plot ruin;
your tongue is like a sharpened razor, *
value.halfverse: O worker of deception.

value.verse: You love evil more than good *
value.halfverse: and lying more than speaking the truth.
O you deceitful tongue.
value.verse: You love all words that hurt, *
Oh, that God would demolish you utterly, *
value.halfverse:
topple you, and snatch you from your dwelling,
 and root you out of the land of the living!
and they shall laugh at him, saying,
value.verse: The righteous shall see and tremble, *
“This is the one who did not take God for a refuge, *
value.halfverse:
but trusted in great wealth
 and relied upon wickedness.”
I trust in the mercy of God for ever and ever.
value.verse: But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God; *

value.halfverse: and declare the goodness of your Name in the presence of the godly.
value.verse: I will give you thanks for what you have done *

en-bcp1979-canticle-12.citation: Song of the Three Young Men, 35-65
en-bcp1979-canticle-12.label: Canticle 12: A Song of Creation

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, all you works of the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.verse: In the firmament of his power, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
O heavens and all waters above the heavens.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, you angels and all powers of the Lord, *
Sun and moon and stars of the sky, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, every shower of rain and fall of dew, *
value.halfverse: all winds and fire and heat.

value.verse: Winter and Summer, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
drops of dew and flakes of snow
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O chill and cold, *

value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: Frost and cold, ice and sleet, glorify the Lord, *
Glorify the Lord, O nights and days, *
value.halfverse: O shining light and enfolding dark.

value.verse: Storm clouds and thunderbolts, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: Let the earth glorify the Lord, *

Glorify the Lord, O mountains and hills,
and all that grows upon the earth, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
O whales and all that move in the waters.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O springs of water, seas, and streams, *

value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: All birds of the air, glorify the Lord, *
Glorify the Lord, O beasts of the wild, *
value.halfverse: and all you flocks and herds.

value.verse: O men and women everywhere, glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.label: II		The Earth and its Creatures

value.verse: Let the people of God glorify the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.

value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O priests and servants of the Lord, *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: Glorify the Lord, O spirits and souls of the righteous, *

value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: You that are holy and humble of heart, glorify the Lord, *
Let us glorify the Lord: Father, Son, and Holy Spirit; *
value.halfverse: praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
praise him and highly exalt him for ever.
value.verse: In the firmament of his power, glorify the Lord, *

Alleluia.
Christ our Passover has been sacrificed for us; *
value.halfverse: therefore let us keep the feast,
but with the unleavened bread of sincerity and truth. Alleluia.
value.verse: Not with the old leaven, the leaven of malice and evil, *

value.halfverse: death no longer has dominion over him.
value.verse: Christ being raised from the dead will never die again; *
The death that he died, he died to sin, once for all; *
value.halfverse: but the life he lives, he lives to God.

value.verse: So also consider yourselves dead to sin, *
value.halfverse: and alive to God in Jesus Christ our Lord. Alleluia.
the first fruits of those who have fallen asleep.
value.verse: Christ has been raised from the dead, *
For since by a man came death, *
value.halfverse: by a man has come also the resurrection of the dead.

value.verse: For as in Adam all die, *
value.halfverse: so also in Christ shall all be made alive. Alleluia.

All are corrupt and commit abominable acts;
 there is none who does any good.
value.verse: The fool has said in his heart, “There is no God.” *

value.halfverse:
to see if there is any who is wise,
 if there is one who seeks after God.
value.verse: God looks down from heaven upon us all, *

value.halfverse: there is none who does good; no, not one.
value.verse:
Every one has proved faithless;
all alike have turned bad; *

value.halfverse:
who eat up my people like bread
 and do not call upon God?
value.verse: Have they no knowledge, those evildoers *

value.halfverse:
for God has scattered the bones of the enemy;
 they are put to shame, because God has rejected them.
value.verse:
See how greatly they tremble,
such trembling as never was; *

value.halfverse:
when God restores the fortunes of his people
 Jacob will rejoice and Israel be glad.
value.verse: Oh, that Israel’s deliverance would come out of Zion! *

value.halfverse: do you judge the peoples with equity?
value.verse: Do you indeed decree righteousness, you rulers? *

value.halfverse: and your hands deal out violence in the land.
value.verse: No; you devise evil in your hearts, *
The wicked are perverse from the womb; *
value.halfverse: liars go astray from their birth.
they are like the deaf adder which stops its ears,
value.verse: They are as venomous as a serpent, *

value.halfverse: no matter how skillful his charming.
value.verse: Which does not heed the voice of the charmer, *

value.halfverse: pull the fangs of the young lions, O LORD.
value.verse: O God, break their teeth in their mouths; *

value.halfverse: let them wither like trodden grass.
value.verse: Let them vanish like water that runs off; *

value.halfverse: like a stillborn child that never sees the sun.
value.verse: Let them be like the snail that melts away, *

value.halfverse: like thorns and thistles let them be swept away.
value.verse: Before they bear fruit, let them be cut down like a brier; *
The righteous will be glad when they see the vengeance; *
value.halfverse: they will bathe their feet in the blood of the wicked.

value.verse:
And they will say,
“Surely, there is a reward for the righteous; *
value.halfverse: surely, there is a God who rules in the earth.”
praise the Name of the LORD.
value.verse: Give praise, you servants of the LORD; *

value.halfverse: from this time forth for evermore.
value.verse: Let the Name of the LORD be blessed, *

value.halfverse: let the Name of the LORD be praised.
value.verse: From the rising of the sun to its going down *

value.halfverse: and his glory above the heavens.
value.verse: The LORD is high above all nations, *

value.halfverse: by day and night I cry to you.
value.verse: O LORD, my God, my Savior, *
Let my prayer enter into your presence; *
value.halfverse: incline your ear to my lamentation.
my life is at the brink of the grave.
value.verse: For I am full of trouble; *
I am counted among those who go down to the Pit; *
value.halfverse: I have become like one who has no strength;

value.verse: Lost among the dead, *
value.halfverse: like the slain who lie in the grave,
for they are cut off from your hand.
value.verse: Whom you remember no more, *
You have laid me in the depths of the Pit, *
value.halfverse: in dark places, and in the abyss.

value.verse: Your anger weighs upon me heavily, *
value.halfverse: and all your great waves overwhelm me.

value.verse:
You have put my friends far from me;
you have made me to be abhorred by them; *
value.halfverse: I am in prison and cannot get free.

LORD, I have called upon you daily;
 I have stretched out my hands to you.
value.verse: My sight has failed me because of trouble; *

value.halfverse: will those who have died stand up and give you thanks?
value.verse: Do you work wonders for the dead? *
Will your loving-kindness be declared in the grave? *
value.halfverse: your faithfulness in the land of destruction?
or your righteousness in the country where all is forgotten?
value.verse: Will your wonders be known in the dark? *

value.halfverse: in the morning my prayer comes before you.
value.verse: But as for me, O LORD, I cry to you for help; *
LORD, why have you rejected me? *
value.halfverse: why have you hidden your face from me?
I have borne your terrors with a troubled mind.
value.verse: Ever since my youth, I have been wretched and at the point of death; *
Your blazing anger has swept over me; *
value.halfverse: your terrors have destroyed me;
they encompass me on every side.
value.verse: They surround me all day long like a flood; *

value.halfverse: and darkness is my only companion.
value.verse: My friend and my neighbor you have put away from me, *
O Lord and Ruler of the hosts of heaven, *
value.halfverse:
God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob,
and of all their righteous offspring:
with all their vast array.
value.verse: You made the heavens and the earth, *

value.halfverse: they tremble because of your power.
value.verse: All things quake with fear at your presence; *

value.halfverse: it surpasses all that our minds can fathom.
value.verse: But your merciful promise is beyond all measure; *
O Lord, you are full of compassion, *
value.halfverse: long-suffering, and abounding in mercy.
you do not punish as we deserve.
value.verse: You hold back your hand; *

value.halfverse: that they may repent of their sin and be saved.
value.verse:
In your great goodness, Lord,
you have promised forgiveness to sinners, *
And now, O Lord, I bend the knee of my heart, *
value.halfverse: and make my appeal, sure of your gracious goodness.

value.verse: I have sinned, O Lord, I have sinned, *
value.halfverse: and I know my wickedness only too well.

value.verse: Therefore I make this prayer to you: *
value.halfverse: Forgive me, Lord, forgive me.

value.verse: Do not let me perish in my sin, *
value.halfverse: nor condemn me to the depths of the earth.
and in me you will show forth your goodness.
value.verse: For you, O Lord, are the God of those who repent, *

value.halfverse: and I will praise you without ceasing all the days of my life.
value.verse:
Unworthy as I am, you will save me,
in accordance with your great mercy, *

value.halfverse: and yours is the glory to ages of ages. Amen.
value.verse: For all the powers of heaven sing your praises, *

value.halfverse: I have trusted in the Lord and have not faltered.
value.verse:
Give judgment for me, O LORD,
for I have lived with integrity; *

value.halfverse: examine my heart and my mind.
value.verse: Test me, O LORD, and try me; *
For your love is before my eyes; *
value.halfverse: I have walked faithfully with you.

value.verse: I have not sat with the worthless, *
value.halfverse: nor do I consort with the deceitful.

value.verse: I have hated the company of evildoers; *
value.halfverse: I will not sit down with the wicked.

value.verse: I will wash my hands in innocence, O LORD, *
value.halfverse: that I may go in procession round your altar,

value.verse: Singing aloud a song of thanksgiving *
value.halfverse: and recounting all your wonderful deeds.
and the place where your glory abides.
value.verse: LORD, I love the house in which you dwell *

value.halfverse: nor my life with those who thirst for blood,
value.verse: Do not sweep me away with sinners, *
Whose hands are full of evil plots, *
value.halfverse: and their right hand full of bribes.

value.verse: As for me, I will live with integrity; *
value.halfverse: redeem me, O LORD, and have pity on me.
in the full assembly I will bless the LORD.
value.verse: My foot stands on level ground; *

value.halfverse:
you have been angry;
 oh, take us back to you again.
value.verse: O God, you have cast us off and broken us; *
You have shaken the earth and split it open; *
value.halfverse: repair the cracks in it, for it totters.
you have given us wine that makes us stagger.
value.verse: You have made your people know hardship; *

value.halfverse: to be a refuge from the power of the bow.
value.verse: You have set up a banner for those who fear you, *
Save us by your right hand and answer us, *
value.halfverse: that those who are dear to you may be delivered.

“I will exult and parcel out Shechem;
  I will divide the valley of Succoth.
value.verse: God spoke from his holy place and said: *

value.halfverse: Ephraim is my helmet and Judah my scepter.
value.verse: Gilead is mine and Manasseh is mine; *

value.halfverse: and over Philistia will I shout in triumph.”
value.verse:
Moab is my wash-basin,
on Edom I throw down my sandal to claim it, *

value.halfverse: who will bring me to Edom?
value.verse: Who will lead me into the strong city? *

value.halfverse: you no longer go out, O God, with our armies.
value.verse: Have you not cast us off, O God? *
Grant us your help against the enemy, *
value.halfverse: for vain is the help of man.

value.verse: With God we will do valiant deeds, *
value.halfverse: and he shall tread our enemies under foot.

value.verse: Your decrees are wonderful; *

it gives understanding to the simple.

let no iniquity have dominion over me.

Rescue me from those who oppress me, *

and teach me your statutes.

The LORD is my shepherd; *

for you are with me;
 your rod and your staff, they comfort me.

Though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death,

you have anointed my head with oil,
 and my cup is running over.

as one who finds great spoils.

because of your righteous judgments.

and I have loved them deeply.

and to sing praises to your Name, O Most High;

The dullard does not know,
nor does the fool understand, *

that though the wicked grow like weeds,

For lo, your enemies, O LORD,
lo, your enemies shall perish, *

the faithful have vanished from among us.

like silver refined from ore

O LORD, watch over us *

save and deliver me from all who pursue me;

trample my life into the ground,

rise up against the fury of my enemies.

Give judgment for me according to my righteousness, O LORD, *

for you test the mind and heart, O righteous God.

Let the malice of the wicked come to an end,
but establish the righteous; *

serve the Lord with gladness

he himself has made us, and we are his;

give thanks to him and call upon his Name.

go into his courts with praise; *

For the Lord is good;
his mercy is everlasting; *

Praise the LORD with the harp; *

let all who dwell in the world stand in awe of him.

he thwarts the designs of the peoples.

on all who dwell on the earth.

a strong man is not delivered by his great strength.

for in his holy Name we put our trust.

 who are determined to trip me up.

and the upright shall continue in your sight.

all evildoers are full of boasting.

 that you avenge the shedding of your servants’ blood.
